title: The Checkerboard

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

credit_line: Ada Turnbull Hertle Endowment; gift of Mrs. Leigh B. Block
publication_history:
James Thrall Soby, Juan Gris, exh. cat. (New York: Museum of Modern Art, 1958), pp. 57, 58, 59 (ill.), as The Checkerboard, 1915.

Esteban Vicente, “Gris: Reality Cubed,” Art News 57, 3 (May 1958), pp. 32 (fig. 3, ill.), 33, as The Checkerboard, 1915.
 
Art Institute, Paintings in The Art Institute of Chicago (Chicago: Art Institute, 1961), pp. 207, 470 (ill.), as The Checkerboard, 1915.

A. James Speyer, “Twentieth-Century European Paintings and Sculpture,” Apollo 84 (September 1966), p. 222, as The Checkerboard, 1915.

George Heard Hamilton, Painting and Sculpture in Europe, 1880 to 1940 (Harmondsworth: Penquin Books, 1967), pp. 159, n.p. (pl. 92a, ill.), as The Chessboard, 1915.

Fine Arts Gallery of San Diego, Masters of Modern Spanish Painting: Legacy of Spain, XXth Century, exh. cat. (San Diego: Fine Arts Gallery, 1969), n.p. (ill.), as The Checkerboard, 1915. 

Orangerie des Tuileries, Juan Gris, exh. cat. (Paris: Orangerie des Tuileries, 1974), p. 89 (cat. 44, ill.), as Le damier, 1915.

Gaya-Nuño, Juan Antonio Juan Gris (Barcelona: Ediciones Polígrafa, 1974), pp. 72 (no. 90, ill.), 241, as El tablero de damas, 1915.

Douglas Cooper, Juan Gris: catalogue raisonné de l’œuvre peint (Paris: Berggruen, 1977), pp. 222 (cat. 148), 223 (ill.), as Le Damier (The Checkerboard), 1915.

E. A. Carmean, Jr., “Juan Gris’ Fantômas,” Arts Magazine 51, 5 (January 1977), pp. 10, 11 (ill.), as Le Damier (The Checkerboard), 1915.

A. James Speyer and Courtney Graham Donnell, Twentieth-Century European Paintings (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1980), p. 45 (no. 2A10), as The Checkerboard (Le Damier), 1915.

Christopher Green, “Synthesis and the ‘Synthetic Process’ in the Painting of Juan Gris 1915–19,” Art History 5, 1 (March 1982), pp. 90, n.p. (fig. 21, ill.), 95, as Le Damier, Sepetember 1915.

Liliane Caffin Madaule, Catalogue Raisonné des Oeuvres de Maria Blanchard, vol. I (London : Editions Liliane Caffin Madule, 1992), 166 (ill.).

Art Institute, Masterworks of Modern Art from The Art Institute of Chicago, exh. cat. (Nagaoka: Niigata Prefectural Museum of Modern Art, 1994), pp. 100 (cat. 27), 101 (ill.), 102, 103 (detail) as The Checkerboard, September 1915.

Gary Apgar and Shaun O’L. Higgins, Colleen Striegel, The Newspaper in Art (Spokane, Wash.: New Media Ventures, 1996), p. 151 (fig. 164, ill.), as The Checkerboard, 1915.
exhibition_history:
New York, Museum of Modern Art, Juan Gris, April 9–June 1, 1958, pp. 57, 58, 59 (ill.), as The Checkerboard, Sept. 1915; traveled to Minneapolis, Institute of Arts, June 24–July 24, 1958; San Francisco, Museum of Art, August 11–September 14, 1958; and Los Angeles County Museum, September 29–October 26, 1958 (New York only).

San Diego, Fine Arts Gallery, Masters of Modern Spanish Painting: Legacy of Spain, XXth Century, January 2–March 4, 1969, n.p. (ill.), as The Checkerboard, 1915. 

Paris, Orangerie des Tuileries, Juan Gris, March 14–July 1, 1974, p. 89 (cat. 44, ill.), as Le damier, 1915.

Nagaoka, Niigata Prefectural Museum of Modern Art, Masterworks of Modern Art from The Art Institute of Chicago, September 1915; April 20–May 29, 1994, pp. 100 (cat. 27), 101 (ill.), 102, 103 (detail) as The Checkerboard; Nagoya, Aichi Prefectural Museum of Art, June 10–July 24, 1994; and Yokohama Museum of Art, August 6–September 25, 1994 (organized by Art Institute of Chicago and Asahi Shimbun).

Fort Worth, Kimbell Art Museum, The Age of Picasso and Matisse: Modern Masters from the Art Institute of Chicago, Oct. 6, 2013–Feb. 16, 2014, no cat. no.
provenance_text: Estate of the artist, from 1927 [Cooper 1977; letter from Eleanore Saidenberg, February 13, 1975, copy in curatorial file]. Galerie Simon, Paris, from 1930 [Saidenberg letter cited above]; sold to the Saidenberg Gallery, New York, 1956 [Saidenberg letter cited above]; sold to the Art Institute, 1956.
